titleStmt.title: The fair and loyal maid of Bristow. Dame fortune on this maiden frown'd, that once on her did smile, she was in tears of sorrow drown'd, that death did her beguile. To the tune of, Jenny Ginn, or, Busie fame.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball, near the Hospital-Gate in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "There lived in Bristol City fair,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
